I bought the world's worst thesaurus yesterday. Not only is it terrible, it's terrible.
I have an EpiPen. My friend gave it to me when he was dying, it seemed very important to him that I have it.
I have the heart of a lion and a lifetime ban from the Toronto zoo.
And God said to John, come forth and you shall be granted eternal life. But John came fifth and won a toaster
What do you call a fake noodle? An impasta
What is red and smells like blue paint? Red paint.
What do you call a nun in a wheelchair? Virgin Mobile
A ghost walks into a bar and orders a shot of vodka. The bartender says "Sorry, we don't serve spirits here."
I went in to a pet shop. I said, "Can I buy a goldfish?" The guy said, "Do you want an aquarium?" I said, "I don't care what star sign it is."
I always heard that as "Where does little Napoleon keep his armies? In his sleevies."
Did you hear about the magic tractor? it was driving down the road and turned into a field.
Intelligence is like an underwear. It is important that you have it, but not necessary that you show it off.
That awkward moment when you leave a store without buying anything and all you can think is 'act natural, you're innocent'
I think my neighbor is stalking me as she's been googling my name on her computer. I saw it through my telescope last night.
